OUTPUT: ['Crewman - A member of the crew aboard a fishing boat, responsible for various tasks such as navigation and maintenance.', 'Angelus - Latin term used to describe wandering or roaming individuals who often have religious significance in Christianity but can also refer to homeless people.', 'Piscator - The person who catches fish; someone involved with the profession of fishing, including those on a fishing boat.', 'Vagabond - A person without a fixed home or employment, often wandering from place to place, which can be applied metaphorically to describe certain behaviors or lifestyles.', 'Anchorage - The process of mooring a vessel at a particular location; in the context of fishing boats, it refers to anchoring for fishing activities.', 'Fisherman - A person who catches fish as their occupation and can refer specifically to those working on a fishing boat.', 'Trawler - A type of large fishing vessel that uses nets (trawls) to capture marine life; CLUE: Document assembled from sections of others
OUTPUT: ['Manuscript - A handwritten or typed document, often referring to an original work by an author.', 'Compilation - A book, recording, or other collection put together from various sources; a gathering of writings or information.', 'Anthology - A published collection of literary works chosen by the compiler, such as poems, short stories, plays, etc.', 'Textbook - An instructional book used in schools and colleges to teach a subject.', 'Encyclopedia - A comprehensive reference work containing articles on various subjects or on numerous aspects of a particular field.', 'Codex - An ancient manuscript text in book form; a collection of written works bound together as one volume.', 'Dossier - A collection of documents about a particular person, event, or subject.', 'Proceedings - The minutes and other reports from a meeting, session, conference, etc.; official record of the proceedings.', 'Digest - A summary or abridgment; a compilation or collection of writings on a specific topic.', "Compiled Works - Books or collections that consist of several authors' works, often edited and compiled into one volume.", 'Reprinted Edition - An edition of a book or other written work published again after the original version has been released.', 'Collection Manuscripts - A document containing multiple manuscripts on similar subjects, arranged together for research purposes.', 'Assembly Book - A bound collection of various texts and writings compiled by an author or editor.', 'Collate - To arrange documents in a sequence to compare their contents or establish chronology.', 'Anthologized Materials - Texts, poems, essays, etc., that have been gathered together from different sources into one collection.', 'Curated Exhibit - A selection of objects, artworks, or writings brought together by a curator for display in an exhibition.', 'Syllabus Compilation - An organized list of topics and readings derived from multiple sources to be used as study material for a course.', 'Collated Records - Multiple sets of records that have been combined and arranged for easy reference or analysis.', 'Assembled Volume - A collection of writings, documents, or works compiled together in one volume or book.', 'Reunited Manuscripts - Individual manuscript sections brought back together from disparate sources to form a complete document or work.']
